newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanians too poor to die - newspaper.
newsitem.headline: Romanians too poor to die - newspaper.

text.p: Romanians plunged into poverty by post-Communist economic change are also finding death beyond their means, the daily Cronica Romana said on Tuesday.
"Being a Christian nowadays is a decided handicap," the newspaper said in a report on the skyrocketing cost of funerals.
"A burial has become a luxury and a huge burden on family members left behind. The only solution is to pray for as long a life as possible."

The daily said traditional Orthodox burials -- including bribes to speed up the issue of a death certificate, payment for undertakers and gravediggers, securing a plot and staging a lavish feast -- now cost on average the equivalent of $900.
Average monthly salaries in the in the Balkan country stand at about $100. Pensioners by law receive an allowance of $40 to cover burial costs.
Many elderly people buy coffins while still alive or arrange graveyard plots for surviving family members.
Bucharest newspapers have reported that bodies have gone unclaimed in city morgues because relatives were unable to pay for funerals.
